notes: P1800 sports coupe (1961-1973). Iconic sports car famously driven by Roger Moore in The Saint. P1800 (1961-1963 Jensen-built), 1800S (1963-1969 Sweden-built), 1800E (1970-1972), 1800ES (1972-1973 shooting brake). Inline-4 B18 or B20 engines. Rear-wheel drive. Vintage parts availability requires specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo P1800 article, January 2025 revision.

140 Series (1966-1974). Angular design replacing Amazon/120 Series. 142 (2-door), 144 (4-door), 145 (wagon). Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engines. Introduced modern safety features including collapsible steering column and disc brakes. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo 140 Series article, January 2025 revision.

164 luxury sedan (1968-1975). Upmarket 6-cylinder variant of 140 Series. Volvo's first inline-6 engine (B30). Longer hood to accommodate inline-6. Rear-wheel drive. Positioned as flagship luxury sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo 164 article, January 2025 revision.

Amazon/120 Series (1956-1970, 1960s coverage). Named Amazon in Sweden, exported as 122S. 121 (1-door), 122S (2/4-door), 123GT (2-door wagon), 221/222 (4-door/wagon). Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engines. Classic three-box design. Highly regarded for durability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo Amazon article, January 2025 revision.
